numlitem.para: Brake accumulator charge is verified normal once each flight day, and
Brake source discrete light is operative.

placard.para: Placard on wheel well accumulator gauge: "BRAKE PRESS GAUGE INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: Check that the BRAKE SOURCE discrete light on the P1 panel is off.
Depressurize hydraulic system No. 4. Check that BRAKE SOURCE discrete light remains off.
Depressurize hydraulic system No. 1. Check that BRAKE SOURCE discrete light remains off.
Depressurize hydraulic system No. 2. Check that BRAKE SOURCE discrete light is on.
Chock the wheels, release the parking brake and depressurize hydraulic systems 1, 2 and 4.
Gain access to the hydraulic brake accumulator direct reading pressure gauge in the right side body landing gear wheel well.
Check that the direct reading pressure gauge adjacent to the hydraulic brake accumulator air charging valve indicates correct pre-charge (approximately 750 psi – see placard adjacent to gauge.)
